Logic Gates

Completed: September 2025

Logic Gates is an interactive educational tool designed to help students and enthusiasts learn about digital logic gates and circuits. This project makes understanding complex digital concepts accessible and engaging through hands-on experimentation.

Project Overview

The Logic Gates simulator provides a visual, interactive environment where users can create and test digital circuits. From basic gates like AND, OR, and NOT to more complex combinations, users can build circuits and see real-time results of their logic.

Key Features

The application includes a drag-and-drop interface for placing logic gates, connection tools for wiring components together, and real-time simulation that shows how signals flow through the circuit. Users can save their circuits, load example projects, and test their designs with different input combinations.

Interactive Learning

Each gate includes tooltips and explanations to help users understand its function. The simulator provides instant feedback, making it easy to experiment and learn through trial and error.

Technical Implementation

Built with modern web technologies, the project uses HTML5 Canvas for rendering circuits, JavaScript for the simulation engine, and CSS for a clean, intuitive user interface.

Simulation Engine

The core of the project is a custom simulation engine that evaluates circuit logic in real-time. It handles signal propagation, manages gate states, and ensures accurate representation of digital logic behavior.

User Interface Design

The UI was designed with beginners in mind, featuring clear visual representations of gates, color-coded wiring to show signal states, and an organized toolbar for easy access to components. The interface is responsive and works seamlessly on both desktop and tablet devices.

Educational Impact

This project aims to make digital logic education more accessible. By providing a free, web-based tool, students can practice building circuits without needing expensive equipment or software licenses.

Use Cases

Teachers use it as a classroom demonstration tool, students practice circuit design for homework, and hobbyists experiment with digital logic concepts. The tool has been particularly useful for remote learning environments.

Future Enhancements

Planned features include more advanced components like flip-flops and multiplexers, a circuit library where users can share their designs, and challenge modes with puzzles to solve. We're also working on adding sequential logic support for more complex circuits.

Logic Gates represents my commitment to making technology education more accessible and engaging. It demonstrates how interactive tools can transform abstract concepts into tangible, understandable experiences.

  • Projects
  • Blogs
  • Contact

Location: Baku, Azerbaijan

Hour of Code

Completed: August 2025

Hour of Code is a beginner-friendly coding tutorial platform designed to introduce programming concepts in an engaging and accessible way. The project aims to make coding education fun and approachable for students of all ages and backgrounds.

Project Mission

This platform was created to lower the barriers to entry for learning programming. By providing interactive tutorials and instant feedback, Hour of Code helps beginners build confidence and develop fundamental coding skills in a supportive environment.

Interactive Learning Experience

The platform features step-by-step tutorials that guide users through basic programming concepts. Each lesson includes interactive code editors where students can write and run code directly in their browser, seeing immediate results of their work.

Gamification Elements

To keep learners engaged, the platform incorporates achievements, progress tracking, and coding challenges. Users earn badges as they complete lessons, creating a sense of accomplishment and motivating continued learning.

Technical Features

Built with React and Node.js, the platform provides a seamless learning experience with real-time code execution and comprehensive progress tracking.

Code Execution Engine

The platform includes a secure code execution engine that runs user code in a sandboxed environment. This ensures safety while allowing students to experiment freely with their code without worrying about breaking anything.

Progress Tracking

Teachers and students can track progress through detailed dashboards. The system monitors completion rates, time spent on lessons, and common areas where students struggle, helping educators provide targeted support.

Educational Approach

The curriculum is designed to introduce concepts gradually, building on previous lessons. Starting with basic syntax and variables, students progress to loops, functions, and eventually more advanced topics like data structures.

Real-World Applications

Each lesson connects programming concepts to real-world applications. Students learn not just syntax, but how to think like programmers and solve practical problems. Projects include creating simple games, building calculators, and designing interactive web pages.

Impact and Reach

Since launch, the platform has helped hundreds of students take their first steps into programming. Teachers use it as a supplementary resource in computer science classes, and many students continue learning independently after completing the initial tutorials.

Hour of Code demonstrates how thoughtful design and interactive learning can make programming education accessible to everyone. It's a step toward a future where coding literacy is as fundamental as reading and writing.

Portfolio Website

Completed: November 2025

This modern and responsive portfolio website showcases my projects, skills, and professional journey as a full-stack developer. Built with a focus on clean design and smooth user experience, it serves as a digital representation of my work and capabilities.

Design Philosophy

The website was designed with a minimalist approach, emphasizing content while maintaining visual appeal. The dark theme with carefully chosen accent colors creates a professional yet modern aesthetic that stands out while remaining easy on the eyes.

User Experience

Navigation is intuitive and straightforward, with a fixed navigation bar that provides easy access to all sections. Smooth scrolling and subtle animations enhance the experience without being distracting. The layout adapts seamlessly to different screen sizes, ensuring a consistent experience across devices.

Animation and Interactions

Custom CSS animations bring the site to life. From the waving hand in the hero section to the flying paper plane in the contact form, these small details add personality and engagement. The blob shape behind the profile image uses keyframe animations to create a dynamic, organic feel.

Technical Implementation

The website is built with vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, demonstrating that powerful, beautiful sites don't always require heavy frameworks. This approach ensures fast loading times and excellent performance.

CSS Architecture

The styling uses modern CSS features including CSS Grid for layout, custom properties for theming, and flexbox for component alignment. The architecture is modular and maintainable, with clear separation between layout, components, and utilities.

Responsive Design

The site is fully responsive, adapting to screens from mobile phones to large desktop monitors. Media queries ensure that content is always readable and well-organized, with layouts that make sense for each device size. Images and videos scale appropriately, and navigation transforms to suit smaller screens.

Content Organization

Content is organized into clear sections: a hero introduction, about me details, featured projects, blog posts, and a contact form. Each section has a specific purpose and guides visitors through my professional story.

Project Showcase

Projects are presented with images, descriptions, and direct links to live demos or repositories. The grid layout ensures equal prominence for each project, while hover effects invite interaction and exploration.

Blog Integration

The blog section demonstrates technical writing skills and provides insights into my development process and interests. Blog posts use semantic HTML for proper structure, with custom styles for headings, code blocks, and other content elements.

Performance Optimization

Despite the animations and styling, the site remains lightweight and fast. Images are optimized for web, CSS is minified for production, and the overall file size is kept minimal. This ensures quick loading even on slower connections.

Accessibility Considerations

The site follows accessibility best practices with semantic HTML, proper heading hierarchy, and sufficient color contrast. Links and buttons have clear focus states, and all interactive elements are keyboard accessible.

Continuous Improvement

The portfolio is a living project that evolves with my skills and experiences. Regular updates add new projects, blog posts, and improvements to design and functionality. The codebase is maintained in GitHub, showcasing version control practices and development workflow.

This portfolio website demonstrates not just my technical skills, but also attention to design details, user experience considerations, and the ability to create polished, professional web applications. It's both a showcase and a practical example of modern web development best practices.
